base.description:
The number base to use for automatic bin determination (default is base 10).

__Default value:__ `10`

divide.description:
Scale factors indicating allowable subdivisions. The default value is [5, 2], which indicates that for base 10 numbers (the default base), the method may consider dividing bin sizes by 5 and/or 2. For example, for an initial step size of 10, the method can check if bin sizes of 2 (= 10/5), 5 (= 10/2), or 1 (= 10/(5*2)) might also satisfy the given constraints.

__Default value:__ `[5, 2]`

maxbins.description:
Maximum number of bins.

__Default value:__ `6` for `row`, `column` and `shape` channels; `10` for other channels

minstep.description: A minimum allowable step size (particularly useful for integer values).

nice.description: If true (the default), attempts to make the bin boundaries use human-friendly boundaries, such as multiples of ten.

step.description:
An exact step size to use between bins.

__Note:__ If provided, options such as maxbins will be ignored.

steps.description: An array of allowable step sizes to choose from.

chartKey.description: key of the chart spec in the page.resources.charts

label.description: optional label if the variableId is not descriptive enough

DataFrameCalculation.description: DataFrame calculation for object arrays. Not for primitive/scalar values.

dataSourceNames.description: The upstream object array source dataSourceName(s) the dataFrameTransformations depends on.

DataLoaderBySpec.description: LLM Should not use this type

content.description: object array or a string or string array of CSV / TSV / DSV

dataSourceName.description: name of the data source, used to reference it in the UI, has same constraints as VariableID
name of the data source, used to reference it in the UI, has same constraints as VariableID
name of the data source, used to reference it in the UI, has same constraints as VariableID

label.description: optional label if the variableId is not descriptive enough

options.description: one of either options or dynamicOptions must be set

size.description: number of options to show at once

DynamicDropdownOptions.description: Dropdown use for selecting from a list of options

dataSourceName.description: name of the data source to use for data

fieldName.description: name of the field to use for options

ImageElement.description: Image element use for displaying images or server-generated visualizations

InteractiveDocumentWithSchema.description: JSON Schema version with $schema property for validation

dataLoaders.description: DataLoaders populate variables for tables and charts Note: 'image' is not a valid type for a variable, do not provide a dataLoader if returnType.type = 'image',  (ImageElements can load images from URLs directly without a DataLoader.)

InteractiveElement.description: Union type for all possible interactive elements

MarkdownElement.description: Use markdown elements to be verbose and descriptive. Do not use as labels for interactive elements. Embed dynamic variables in markdown using double curly braces {{variableId}} as a placeholder for their values.

MermaidElement.description: Mermaid use for rendering Mermaid diagrams, either static or dynamic

diagramText.description: Static option: the raw Mermaid diagram text

NumberElement.description: Number use for numeric input (integers and decimals)

label.description: optional label if the variableId is not descriptive enough

PageElement.description: Union type for all possible elements

css.description: CSS styles, either a string, or array of strings which will be concatenated. The array is for developer ergonomics for authoring and merging.

PresetsElement.description: Presets use for storing and applying preset batches of signal states

isArray.description: in our system, a pandas dataframe is an array of objects

ScalarCalculation.description: Scalar calculation for primitive values. Not for object arrays.

vegaExpression.description: Vega expression language, used to calculate the value based on other variables.

SliderElement.description: Slider prefer sliders over textbox for numbers. Never use for boolean values.

label.description: optional label if the variableId is not descriptive enough

dataSourceName.description: Name of the data source to use for incoming data (output data is available via the variableId of this table element)

tabulatorOptions.description: Tabulator options (must be JSON stringify-able, so no callbacks allowed)

TemplatedUrl.description: A url, it may contain template variables, e.g. https://example.com/{{category}}/{{item}}

TextboxElement.description: Textbox use sparingly - typically only for text input

label.description: optional label if the variableId is not descriptive enough

TreebarkElement.description: Treebark use for rendering cards and structured HTML from templates

template.description: Treebark template object for rendering HTML structure

VariableID.description:
VariableID

- The VariableID is an identifier for a variable.
- Do NOT use operator characters in the VariableID, such as /|\\\'"`,.;:~-=+?!@#$%^&*()[]{}<> 
- Do NOT use space characters in the VariableID, but you may use underscores.
- Do NOT prefix the VariableID with a digit.
- Do NOT prefix/suffix the VariableID with the type, e.g. "value_number" is bad.
- The following names are not allowed as VariableIDs: "width", "height", "padding", "autosize", "background", "style", "parent", "datum", "item", "event", "cursor", "encodeUriComponent"
